column3: Y-You wish to ask me questions? I should be glad to tell you what I know! As for a fitting payment... Ah, yes─I ask that you listen to me!
What kind of place is this?
I'm just a Nu Mou like any other. I offer my services to those in need in return for a fitting payment.
Though if you ask the others, I'm terrible at setting prices. They say I ask for too little in return.
To that I say to each their own. As long as one is satisfied, then a fitting payment has been rendered, don't you agree?
This cave is called Pla Enni, and our people have called it home for generations. To the pixies, it's a dank and dark and dreary place, but this is precisely the way we Nu Mou like it.
Lest you wonder, Pla Enni is the name of a variety of mushroom that's central to our lives. We make our homes out of them, and use their spores to prepare our magical concoctions.
Alas, with the men of Voeburt long departed, few come seeking our concoctions these days, leaving us starved of the patronage we crave. <sigh> Such a trying time this is...
